title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Ramiro Magno. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
title: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
text: vermeulen provides Biomarker data set Vermeulen et al. (2009) tidy format. data set real-time quantitative PCR experiment comprises: raw fluorescence data 24,576 amplification curves. 64 targets: 59 genes interest 5 reference genes. 366 neuroblastoma cDNA samples 18 dilution series samples.

title: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
text: Install vermeulen CRAN: can instead install development version vermeulen GitHub:

title: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
text: CRAN size limits data provided installation time. data can retrieved GitHub repository installation function get_biomarker_dataset(). Types samples:
code: library(vermeulen) library(tibble) library(dplyr)  # Takes a few seconds (downloading from GitHub...) biomarker <- as_tibble(get_biomarker_dataset()) biomarker #> # A tibble: 1,226,880 × 11 #>    plate well  dye   target target_t…¹ sample sampl…² copies dilut…³ cycle fluor #>    <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>      <chr>  <fct>    <int>   <dbl> <int> <dbl> #>  1 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     1  1.10 #>  2 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     2  1.45 #>  3 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     3  1.46 #>  4 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     4  1.47 #>  5 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     5  1.47 #>  6 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     6  1.45 #>  7 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     7  1.48 #>  8 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     8  1.46 #>  9 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA     9  1.47 #> 10 AHCY  A1    SYBR  AHCY   toi        1495   unk         NA      NA    10  1.46 #> # … with 1,226,870 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​target_type, #> #   ²​sample_type, ³​dilution #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows count(   distinct(biomarker, plate, well, sample_type, copies, dilution),   sample_type,   copies,   dilution ) #> # A tibble: 7 × 4 #>   sample_type copies dilution     n #>   <fct>        <int>    <dbl> <int> #> 1 ntc              0      Inf   192 #> 2 std             15    10000   192 #> 3 std            150     1000   192 #> 4 std           1500      100   192 #> 5 std          15000       10   192 #> 6 std         150000        1   192 #> 7 unk             NA       NA 23424

title: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
text: Please note vermeulen project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Biomarker Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009)
text: Vermeulen et al.. Predicting outcomes children neuroblastoma using multigene-expression signature: retrospective SIOPEN/COG/GPOH study. Lancet Oncology 10, 663–671 (2009). doi: 10.1016/S1470-2045(09)70154-8. Ruijter et al.. Evaluation qPCR curve analysis methods reliable biomarker discovery: Bias, resolution, precision, implications. Methods 59 32–46 (2013). doi: 10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.08.011.

what: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
title: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
text: function retrieves Biomarker data set, data set containing raw fluorescence amplification data: 24,576 amplification curves, 50 cycles .

title: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
text: https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip https://github.com/ramiromagno/vermeulen/tree/main/data-raw

title: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
text: data frame 24,576 amplification curves, 50 cycles : plate Plate identifier. one plate used per gene, name plate values target. well Well identifier. dye reactions SYBR Green master mix (Roche) used, value always "SYBR". target Target identifier, almost cases name gene. target_type Target type: either target interest ("toi") reference target ("ref"). sample Sample identifier. sample_type Sample type. copies Standard copy number. dilution Dilution factor. Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
text: Data gathered Ruijter et al. (2013), doi:10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.08.011  original source Vermeulen et al. (2009), doi:10.1016/S1470-2045(09)70154-8 . tidy version data kept repository source {vermeulen} package. function fetches data thus requires internet connection. takes seconds run. Biomarker data set comprises set 59 targets previously identified 59-mRNA gene expression signature, developed validated improved outcome prediction children neuroblastoma. short, 59 biomarkers 5 reference genes measured 8 µl reactions 384-well plate using LightCycler480 SYBR Green Master (Roche) sample maximization experiment design. 59 genes carefully selected previously reported prognostic genes neuroblastoma least two independent studies. plate contained 366 cDNA samples (n = 1) primary tumor biopsies, 5-point 10-fold serial dilution series based external oligonucleotide standard (n = 3, 150,000 15 copies), template control (NTC, n = 3). Raw (baseline uncorrected) fluorescent data exported LightCycler480 instrument software.

title: Import the Biomarker data set — get_biomarker_dataset
code: # \donttest{ # Takes ~ 10-30 sec head(get_biomarker_dataset()) #>   plate well  dye target target_type sample sample_type copies dilution cycle #> 1  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     1 #> 2  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     2 #> 3  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     3 #> 4  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     4 #> 5  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     5 #> 6  AHCY   A1 SYBR   AHCY         toi   1495         unk     NA       NA     6 #>      fluor #> 1 1.102538 #> 2 1.453846 #> 3 1.463030 #> 4 1.471323 #> 5 1.473840 #> 6 1.453012 # }

what: vermeulen: 'Biomarker' Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009) — vermeulen-package
title: vermeulen: 'Biomarker' Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009) — vermeulen-package
text: 'biomarker' data set Vermeulen et al. (2009) doi:10.1016/S1470-2045(09)70154-8  provided. data source, however, Ruijter et al. (2013) doi:10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.08.011 . original data set may downloaded https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip. data set real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction ('PCR') experiment comprises raw fluorescence data 24,576 amplification curves. data set comprises 59 genes interest 5 reference genes. gene assessed 366 neuroblastoma complementary DNA ('cDNA') samples 18 standard dilution series samples (10-fold 5-point dilution series x 3 replicates + template controls ('NTC') x 3 replicates).

title: vermeulen: 'Biomarker' Data Set by Vermeulen et al. (2009) — vermeulen-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno ramiro.magno@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder]

title: vermeulen 0.1.1
text: now one function, get_biomarker_dataset(), allows download entire Biomarker data set one call. replaces previous helpers. Fetching functions now memoised thus providing greater convenience running interactively. order levels column well now fixed: A1, A2, … instead A1, A10, …

title: vermeulen 0.1.0
text: First release package.
